resources.string:
" New Features: 
 - Added unit converter - Revised history - Improved introduction - Notifications are sent if enabled - Various languages ​​such as German, English, Spanish, and French - Bugs can be reported in the top right of the settings - Improved release notes


Fixed Issues:
 - Back button was faulty - Missing unit in the converter - Layout error in the calculator


Removed Features:
 - Enable and disable release notes in settings


System Requirements:
 - Minimum Android version: 10 - Recommended Android version: 13 or higher - Maximum Android version: 14 "

The latest RechenMax version brings exciting improvements and features. Automatic scrolling makes it easier to navigate large calculations, while the rounding precision has been increased to the eleventh decimal place for more precise decimal numbers. History has been optimized to effortlessly restore previous calculations and review past tasks. In trigonometric tasks, advanced functions for sine, cosine and tangent in degrees and radians are available. Inverse trigonometric functions (sin⁻¹, cos⁻¹, tan⁻¹) as well as hyperbolic functions such as sinh(x), cosh(x) and tanh(x) are now also available. Manual notation entry provides additional flexibility when creating and calculating complex expressions. The RechnenMax now supports the use of the mathematical constant PI (π) for precise circle calculations. With the flexible support of degrees and radians, you can switch between the two units of measurement as needed. Brackets handling has been optimized to ensure error-free processing of mathematical or logical expressions. The software automatically detects and adds missing closing brackets, further simplifying expression entry. In history, long-pressing on an entry allows the invoice to be automatically copied to the clipboard, while short-pressing pastes the invoice directly into the calculator. This release also fixes important bugs, including display and factorial calculation issues, as well as optimized result formatting for more accurate display.
Creator: Max Lemberg Copyright: © 2024 Max Lemberg. All rights reserved. License: This product is licensed under the Apache 2.0 License. Version: 1.6.4

1: This area (calculation area) displays the calculation you entered. You can also copy the contents of the area by long-pressing the area. 2: The result of the calculation carried out is displayed in this area (result area). You can also copy the contents of the area by long-pressing the area.

After you have completed your calculation, press the \'=\' key to calculate the result. The result will then be displayed for you in the results area. This simple procedure allows you to get the results of your calculations quickly and easily.

With this setting you can specify whether the entries are first displayed in the results area and then inserted into the calculation area using an operator (standard), or whether they are written directly in the calculation area (simplified).

In this area you can click on numbers to gradually add them to the current result in the results area. This allows you to easily put together your desired combination of numbers and shows you transparently how the result changes with each selection.

In the action bar you will find the history button, which allows you to access and view your previous calculations. This handy button makes it easier for you to quickly find your previous calculations and refer back to them when needed, whether to check results or repeat previous calculations.

You can view previous calculations in the history. The delete button (top right) clears the entire history, the back button (top left) returns to the calculator. A long press copies a calculation to the clipboard, a short press pastes it into the calculator, and a double tap deletes a single calculation.

Various settings with detailed descriptions are available to you here. If you want to go back to the home page, just use the button at the top left. In addition, you will find the button at the top right that will take you to the introduction to the calculator. This means you can easily access the functions and information you want.
If you go back to the home page, you will find the Settings button. If you press it you will be redirected to the calculator settings.
"By clicking on the field marked above, you can choose between different measurements. To select a new measurement, simply click on it."

"By clicking on the field marked above, you can choose between different units. To select a new unit, simply click on it. Additionally, you can set the number of decimal places to be displayed in the result in the settings under the \'Decimal Places' section. If you want to copy the result of a conversion, press and hold on the number next to the corresponding unit."
"If you now click on the arrow marked above, you will return to the calculator."
"You can switch to the converter by clicking on the highlighted button above."
"You can switch to the history by clicking on the highlighted button above."
"You can return to the main menu, i.e., the calculator, by pressing the \'Back\' button at the top left."
"You can delete your history by clicking on the trash can icon at the top right and then confirming your decision. Note that the history will be completely and permanently deleted."

"Each calculation shows the date and time it was performed. Below, you\'ll find the result and a notes field where you can add annotations about the calculation. Additionally, the text will be copied to your clipboard if you press and hold on the result or calculation. Double-clicking on the calculation or result will delete the entire task."
"You can access the calculator\'s settings by clicking on the gear icon at the top right."
"Now you can make and modify various settings."
"You can access the help or introduction again later by clicking on the highlighted button in the top right corner."
"You can return to the settings by clicking on the highlighted button at the top."
"If you have found a bug, you can report it by clicking on the highlighted button at the top."
"You can return to the settings by clicking on the highlighted button at the top."

For precise editing, various delete functions are available: \'⌫\' removes the last number or character entered from the result area, \'CE\' deletes the entire result area and \'C\' empties both the result and calculation areas.
To activate scientific mode, simply press the corresponding button in the top left. This will reveal additional features.

When scientific mode is enabled, additional features appear. At the top left you see two arrows, next to them a number (1, 2 or 3) and the mode \'Deg\' or \'Rad\'. Using the arrows and the selected mode indicated by the number, you can switch between scientific mode modes, which contain different functions. In addition, you can set the degree with \'Deg\' and the radian with \'Rad\'. \'(\': Puts an open bracket in the calculation area. \')\': Puts a closed bracket in the calculation area. \'x!\': Takes the entered number from the result area and inserts it with the factorial character. \'√x\': The root of the number that comes from the result range. \'e\': Euler\'s number (approx. 2.7182)

The \'Degrees / Radians\' setting allows you to choose between two common units of measurement for angles: degrees and radians. One degree divides the angle into 360 parts, which form a full circle. In radians, angle is measured based on the radius of a circle. A full circle is equal to 2π radians, where π is approximately 3.14159. A right angle is π/2 radians. Radians allow precise relationships between angle and circle radius and are used in advanced mathematical calculations.

There are three different tabs with different functions, which you can switch by pressing the corresponding button. Tab 1: \'sin(x)\': Sine function \'cos(x)\': Cosine function \'tan(x)\': Tangent function \'e±\': \'π\': Circle number PI \'sin⁻¹(x)\': Inverse sine function \' cos⁻¹(x)\': Inverse cosine function \'tan⁻¹(x)\': Inverse tangent function Tab 2: \'sinh(x)\': Hyperbolic sine function \'cosh(x)\': Hyperbolic cosine function \'tanh(x)\': Hyperbolic Tangent function \'sinh⁻¹(x)\': Inverse hyperbolic sine function \'cosh⁻¹(x)\': Inverse hyperbolic cosine function \'tanh⁻¹(x)\': Inverse hyperbolic tangent function Tab 3: \'log(x)\': Logarithm to the base 10 \'log₂(x)\': logarithm to base 2 \'logₓ(x)\': logarithm to base x \'ln(x)\': natural logarithm to base e (approximately 2.71828) \'³√x\': cube root \'½ \': half (0.5) \'⅓\': third (0.3333…) \'¼\': quarter (0.25)

There is also an action bar that allows you to switch between different tabs (history and settings) as well as science mode. This function gives you the opportunity to flexibly navigate between your calculation history, individual settings and the advanced science mode.
This setting causes the blacks to become more intense and the whites to dim slightly when activated. Please note that this setting only takes effect when dark mode is enabled.

If this option is enabled, the release notes will be displayed every time you start the calculator. Regardless of this setting, the release notes are automatically presented after each installation of the latest version.
This option allows you to select the display mode of the calculator.

Do you need help or are you new here? This comprehensive guide will take you through all the buttons and functions of the RechenMax in detail. RechenMax offers a variety of powerful tools and options to efficiently handle your computing needs.

For arithmetic operations, simply use one of the highlighted characters. For example, if you select \'×\', the operator will be immediately inserted in the results pane. Then add a number (e.g., \'3\') and use additional operators as needed. This is how you design your calculation processes simply and step by step.

By pressing the \'Comma button\' you have the option to add a comma to the results area. It is important to note that if a comma is already present, no more will be added. This function allows precise entry of decimal places.

If you want a number to become negative, press the \'±\' button. Press it again if you want the number to be positive again. This feature allows you to easily change the sign and ensures that you can quickly and easily adjust your numbers as needed.
If necessary, the upper calculation area automatically scrolls downwards.\n
The rounding precision of the decimal number has been increased from the tenth to the eleventh decimal place.\n

Long press: Long-pressing an entry in the history automatically copies the associated invoice to the clipboard. Short press: A short press on a history entry inserts the corresponding calculation directly into the calculator.\n
This new function offers expanded functionality in the area of trigonometric functions. You can now easily calculate sine, cosine and tangent in degrees as well as in radians.\n
This new feature provides expanded functionality in the area of hyperbolic functions. One can now calculate sinh(x), cosh(x) and tanh(x) for arbitrary real values of x.\n
The new logarithm functions (log(x), log₂(x) and ln(x)) make it possible to calculate different logarithms for any real values of x:\n

In addition, you can now also use the inverse trigonometric functions sine^-1 (sin⁻¹), cosine^-1 (cos⁻¹) and tangent^-1 (tan⁻¹). Please note that these functions have certain limitations and are only defined for values in the valid definition range.\n

For added flexibility, the app now allows notations to be entered manually. Just follow these steps: Enter any number, press the \'e±\' key (for \'×10\'), select plus (\'+\') or minus (\'-\') for a positive or negative exponent . Then enter your exponent after the plus or minus and the number will be converted automatically.\n
RechenMax now supports the use of PI (π), a mathematical constant that represents the ratio of a circle\'s circumference to its diameter.\n

Degrees and radians are now supported, allowing flexible switching between the two units of measurement. The degree measure is typically used in geometric and trigonometric calculations, while the radian measure is relevant in more advanced mathematical concepts.\n
Missing brackets are now automatically detected and automatically completed, further simplifying the entry of expressions.\n
The handling of parentheses has been optimized to ensure error-free processing of mathematical or logical expressions.\n
Individual calculations can be removed in the history with a double click.\n
Euler\'s number was implemented to extend calculations.\n
Cube root function \'³√\' integrated for advanced calculations.\n
In this version \'½\', \'⅓\' and \'¼\' have been added to diversify the calculations and achieve more precise results.\n
There is now a help function, which can be found in the settings, which explains all the functions of the calculator.\n
Within the settings you can now select different calculation modes to adapt the functionality of the calculator to your individual needs.\n
The app automatically goes into the background as soon as it is closed. This will be indicated by a notification.\n

RechenMax sends a notification if the app has not been used within a 4-day interval and permission has been granted. Also, keep in mind that this feature is only available starting from API 33 (Android 13).\n
RechenMax also sends a Hint every day that contains helpful hints or background information. Also, keep in mind that this feature is only available starting from API 33 (Android 13).\n
"It happened that after returning from the help function, an error was displayed.\n
It could happen that under certain circumstances the calculation areas were not displayed or were only partially displayed.\n
The factorial calculation has been optimized to ensure that the calculator does not crash due to extremely large numbers.\n
Under certain circumstances, scientific notations were not converted correctly. This issue has been resolved to ensure more reliable functionality.\n
Fixed the incorrect result formatting issue to ensure more accurate and consistent display.
The calculator is now available in German, English, Spanish, and French.
With this setting, you can choose how many decimal points should be displayed in the converter. However, note that a higher number of decimal points may affect performance.
Minimum Android version: 10\nRecommended Android version: 13 or higher\nMaximum Android version: 14
With this setting, you can choose whether to receive a daily tip or information about the calculator.
With this setting, you can choose whether to receive a notification reminding you to use the calculator every four days in case you haven\'t used it.

To receive notifications, enable this setting. However, please note that you must allow the app to send you notifications. Also, keep in mind that this feature is only available starting from API 33 (Android 13). Additionally, reminders or daily tips must be enabled for a notification to be sent.
Thank you. The error will be fixed as soon as possible.
Choose an application to send from
Please provide your name or a preferred alias for personalized communication. (Optional)
Please provide a suitable title for the issue. This can be either a brief description or a keyword.
Now, describe the issue in detail. \nPlease note that the more detailed the description, the more likely it can be resolved.
Please note that the converter is still in development and may produce inaccurate results. You can report an error by clicking on the flag at the top right in the settings if you have found one.
With this, you can configure whether you want to see the warning message each time it appears when starting the converter, to ensure that you are informed about potential risks.

With this function, you can set it up so that whenever you enter the number \'3.14\', it will automatically be replaced by the symbol for Pi. This simplifies entering Pi in your calculations, allowing you to focus on the task at hand without having to constantly search for the symbol.

This setting allows you to determine whether the text in your history is displayed as a scrollbar, meaning you can scroll the text from left to right and it will be displayed on a single line, or if the text is displayed on multiple lines below each other.
This button is disabled in the current mode.
Please activate the channel in your phone\'s settings first.
Please enable notifications in your phone\'s settings first.
